result.execSummary:
The defendant Westin Duane Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Westin Duane Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Westin Duane Smith was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: The Defendant shall notify Attorney Dan Johns of any change of address or phone number within five (5) days of such change.  The Defendant shall have quarterly contact with Attorney Dan Johns via phone or letter.  Def shall pay the sum of $65/quarter to Atty Dan Johns for monitoring this agreement.  Def shall make arrangements with the Iron County Clerk of Court for payment of any applicable attorney costs, court costs, surcharges, fines, and forfeitures.  Def shall have no contract with E.N.  Def's bond conditions will not continue.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Westin Duane Smith

records.addlTxt: 03:18 PM Defendant Westin Duane Smith in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann appeared by video means for Defendant Westin Duane Smith.   Court calls case.  Provides case background.  Atty Hoffmann acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Def understands charges, rights and waives reading of complaint and stands mute to all counts.  Clerk to enter NG pleas.  $1,000 cash has been posted.  Also $500 cash posted.  DA references older cases.  Requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions of no alcohol, no controlled substances and testing on demand.  Case to be set for PTC.  Atty Hoffmann addresses court re old cases and DEJs.  Def still has time left to serve in Iron County.  DA provides info to Court re def's failure to appear was reason for warrants.  Atty Hoffmann responds.  Court grants $5,000 cash bond in addition to what has already been posted totalling $6,500, with conditions as requested by DA.  Atty Hoffmann has no objections but asks that warrants be quashed.  Court sets bond as requested and quashes warrant.  PTC to be scheduled for 9/23 at 9:30 a.m.  Adj.  3:27 p.m.  klr

ADDRESS INFO for Westin Duane Smith
Current: 116 Mansfield, Ironwood, MI 49938 United States  (Effective: 09-01-2020)
Prior: 404 S Peck Street, Bessemer, MI 49911
